text: is a Japanese architect.Kenneth Frampton, Kenneth. "Arata Isozaki," Grove Art Online (2009). Retrieved 2012-2-29. ==Early life== Isozaki was born in Ōita.Corkill, Edan. "Arata Isozaki: Astonishing by design". Japan Times, 1 June 2008. Retrieved 2012-2-29. He studied with Kenzo Tange, Kisho Kurokawa, and Fumihiko Maki at the University of Tokyo. He graduated in 1954. ==Career== Isozaki worked for Kenzo Tange & Urtec from 1954 to 1963. He started his own design office in 1963.Arata Isozaki & Associates, Profile. Retrieved 2012-2-29. In 2005, Arata Isozaki started another office in Italy called Arata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associates.Arata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associati, Practice profile. Retrieved 2012-2-29. Isozaki was awarded the Pritzker Architecture Prize in March 2019. ==List of projects== * Ōita Prefectural Library, Ōita, Japan, 1966 * Kitakyushu Municipal Museum of Art, Kitakyushu, Japan, 1974 * Kitakyushu Central Library, Kitakyushu, Japan, 1975 * West Japan General Exhibition Center, Kitakyushu, Japan, 1977 * Museum of Contemporary Art (MOCA), Los Angeles, California, US, 1987 * Art Tower Mito, Japan, 1990 * Palau Sant Jordi for the 1992 Summer Olympics, Barcelona, Spain, 1990ArchNet.org, Arata Isozaki. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * Team Disney, Orlando, Florida, US, 1992 * Domus Casa Del Hombre, La Coruña, Spain, 1995 * Kyoto Concert Hall, Kyoto, Japan, 1995 * Granship Convention Center, Shizuoka, Shizuoka, Japan, 1999Ikeda, Satoru. "Granship" (Shizuoka Convention & Arts Center) "Sails Forth" as a New Home for Japanese Cultural, Sports and Other Events," Nagata Acoustics News, Vol. 99-6, No.138, June 25, 1999. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * University of Central Asia's three campuses in Tekeli, Kazakhstan; Naryn, the Kyrgyz Republic; and Khorog, Tajikistan, 2004Arata Isozaki & Associates, Projects. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * Torino Palasport Olimpico, Turin, Italy, 2006Arata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associati, Turin Ice Hockey Stadium. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * Diamond Island, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, 2006 * Himalayas Center, Shanghai, China, 2008 : ... * 2011 — Maranello Library, Maranello, ItalyArata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associati, Maranello New Library. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * 2012 — Bologna Station, Bologna, ItalyArata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associati, Bologna Station. Retrieved 2012-2-29. * 2014 — Citylife, Milan, ItalyArata Isozaki & Andrea Maffei Associati, Citylife. Retrieved 2012-2-29. ==Honors== * Royal Institute of British Architects, Royal Gold Medal, 1986 ==References== ==Other websites== * Arata Isozaki & associates website Category:Pritzker Architecture Prize winners Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese architects Category:People from Ōita Prefecture
title: Arata Isozaki
